meanings.definition: To set up for use or service
meanings.sent1: Dad is installing the new TV in the living room.
meanings.sent2: The technician will be installing the software on your computer.
meanings.sent3: The cat thinks it's installing itself as the king of the house.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like installing sunshine into a gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret ingredient was like installing magic into the dish.

meanings.definition: To place in position for operation
meanings.sent1: The mechanic is installing the new engine in the car.
meanings.sent2: The electrician will be installing the light fixtures in the hallway.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was installing acorns in every nook and cranny.
meanings.sent4: His words were like installing a sense of calm in the chaotic room.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes were like installing life into the painting.

meanings.definition: To establish in an office, position, or place
meanings.sent1: The company is installing a new CEO next month.
meanings.sent2: The government is installing a new mayor in the city.
meanings.sent3: The kids were installing themselves as the rulers of the playground.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like installing a pillar of strength in the team.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's guidance was like installing a compass for the students.
